title: Technavio Says Increased Focus on Developing Markets Will Propel the Global Cigarette Market Through 2019
text:
Fri, Aug 28, 2015, 5:11 AM AEST - Australia Markets open in 4 hrs 49 mins Technavio Says Increased Focus on Developing Markets Will Propel the Global Cigarette Market Through 2019 Press Release : Technavio Research – 4 hours ago Recommend 
LONDON--(BUSINESSWIRE)-- Technavio has published a new report on the global cigarette market ,which is expected to grow at a CAGR of nearly 6% from 2015-2019. 
About the Report 
As per the new market research report by Technavio, several cigarette and tobacco manufacturing companies like British American Tobacco (BAT), Philip Morris International (PMI), Imperial Tobacco Group (ITG) and Japan Tobacco International (JTI) have shifted their focus from developed countries to developing countries. 
“The cigarette market is showing positive signs in the developing countries due to growing population and rising standards of living. Four of the 10 largest cigarette-consuming countries are in the APAC region, thus making it the fastest-growing region in this market,” says Faisal Ghaus, Vice President of Technavio. 
The latest report by Technavio also underlines product innovation, which are common in mature markets in order to sustain the curiosity and interest of consumers, and the cigarette market is no different. 
“Many companies time and again introduce new variants of old products to encourage brand recognition among consumers,” adds Ghaus. 
Market Scope and Calculation of Market Size 
The new Technavio report covers the present scenario and growth prospects of the global cigarette market from 2015-2019. In terms of value and volume, the market size was calculated taking into consideration the retail sales generated through the following distribution channels: Tobacconists
